snippet: An eight-month ordeal for two Swiss citizens held hostage in northwestern Pakistan ended early on Thursday when their Taliban captors set them free.
abstract: Swiss couple that had been held hostage by the Taliban in northwestern Pakistan for eight months turns up at a military checkpoint; they are flown to Islamabad, where they are handed over to the Swiss Embassy.

byline.contributor: Ismail Khan contributed reporting from Peshawar, Pakistan, and Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud from Islamabad.

lead_paragraph: An eight-month ordeal for two Swiss citizens held hostage in northwestern Pakistan ended early on Thursday when their Taliban captors set them free.

headline.seo: 8-Month Ordeal in Pakistan Ends for 2 Swiss Hostages
headline.main: Ordeal in Pakistan Ends for 2 Swiss Hostages
headline.print_headline: 8-Month Ordeal in Pakistan Ends for 2 Swiss Hostages of the Taliban
